Distance From Dubai International Airport to Charles De Gaulle Airport (DXB - CDG Distance)

The flight distance from Dubai International Airport (DXB) to Charles De Gaulle Airport (CDG) is 3255 miles. This is equivalent to 5239 kilometers or 2827 nautical miles. The distance shown below is the straight line distance (may be called as flying or air distance) or direct flight distance between airports.


5239 kilometers is the distance from Dubai International Airport, United Arab Emirates to Charles De Gaulle Airport, France.

Flight Duration between Dubai, United Arab Emirates and Paris, France

Estimated flight time from Dubai International Airport, Dubai, United Arab Emirates to Charles De Gaulle Airport, Paris, France is 6 hours 30 minutes under avarage conditions. The flight time calculator assumes an average flight speed for a commercial airliner of 500 mph, which is equivalent to 805 km/hr or 434 knots. Your actual flying time may vary depending on wind speeds or weather conditions.

Time Difference Between the Airports • DXB - CDG

Time difference between Dubai (United Arab Emirates) and Paris (France) is 3 Hours.
Current local time in Dubai is 2025-11-04, 01:05:46 +04 and time in Paris is 2025-11-03, 22:05:46 CET.
Paris time is 3 Hours behind Dubai.
